tn.text: A woman whom other people must not touch because she is bleeding from her womb is spoken of as if she were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: during the days of her monthly period
tn.text: This refers to the time of the month when a woman bleeds from her womb. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: the flesh of a baby boy's foreskin must be circumcised
tn.text: Only the priest could perform this action. This can be translated in active form. AT: "a priest must circumcise the baby boy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the mother's purification from her bleeding will continue for thirty-three days
tn.text: three days** - This means that the mother will remain impure for thirty-three days.

tn.ref: she will be unclean for two weeks
tn.text: A woman whom other people must not touch because she is bleeding from her womb is spoken of as if she were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This refers to the time of the month when a woman bleeds from her womb. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:12:01|12:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: When the days of her purification are finished
tn.text: "When the days of the mother's purification are finished"

tn.ref: for a son or for a daughter
tn.text: This refers to the different number of days for purification based on if she gave birth to a son or daughter.

tn.ref: and she will be cleansed from the flow of her blood
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "and this will cleanse her from her bleeding occurring during childbirth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: If she is not able to afford a lamb
tn.text: Translate this so it clarifies the woman's inability to purchase a sacrificial animal. AT: "If she does not have enough money to buy a lamb" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
A woman whom other people may touch is spoken of as if she were physically clean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
